> Teku actually does consistently generate better attestation rewards, though the difference is small.  
I'm curious how (and when) this was measured? The biggest difference in rewards is first and foremost who get to reap slashings (which is random), who gets to produce blocks (which is also random) - also, clients are probably adjusting over each release to improve performance where it matters based on network growth etc - ie lighthouse fixing a block production delay will increase the profits of their users a bit etc

author: potuz
content: In addition, some bugs in one client affect others, eg. Some clients not broadcasting attestations for unknown blocks affect those clients that attest fast while it doesn't those that deliberately delay attestations. I suppose having a good measurement of client performance is possible, but the only reference to Teku performing better that I know is from a tweet of Ben Edington and the y axis was misleading to say the least
